OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: In third panel, changed label from “…in peritoneum” to “Cancer in pelvic peritoneum”.
For the right panel, centered Stage II as done for the left and middle panel; moved the label Primary Peritoneal Cancer to the bottom of the right panel.

REVISED IMAGE per FIGO update: Removed "ovarian cancer" from title; In the first panel, moved Ovary label to right side of image and moved label for Cancer down under ovary on left side of image and made lines point to the three cancer spots; in the middle panel, deleted the cancer spot shown at the junction of the fallopian tube and the uterus on the left side of the image; deleted the former last panel and replaced it with a panel titled Stage II Primary Peritoneal Cancer and expanded the little inset from the former panel to fill it. Changed the label to say “Cancer in peritoneum and labeled the Peritoneum.
Added Colon label to stage IIC.

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Three-panel drawing of stage IIA, IIB, and stage II primary peritoneal cancer; the first panel (stage IIA) shows cancer inside both ovaries that has spread to the uterus and fallopian tube. The second panel (stage IIB) shows cancer inside both ovaries that has spread to the colon. The third panel (stage II primary peritoneal cancer) shows cancer in the pelvic peritoneum. Also shown are the cervix and vagina.

Three-panel drawing of stage IIA, IIB, and stage II primary peritoneal cancer; the first panel (stage IIA) shows cancer inside both ovaries that has spread to the uterus and fallopian tube. The second panel (stage IIB) shows cancer inside both ovaries that has spread to the colon. The third panel (stage II primary peritoneal cancer) shows cancer in the pelvic peritoneum. Also shown are the cervix and vagina.

Captions.MediaCaption: In stage IIA, cancer is found in one or both ovaries or fallopian tubes and has spread to the uterus and/or the fallopian tubes and/or the ovaries. In stage IIB, cancer is found in one or both ovaries or fallopian tubes and has spread to the colon. In primary peritoneal cancer, cancer is found in the pelvic peritoneum and has not spread there from another part of the body.

In stage IIA, cancer is found in one or both ovaries or fallopian tubes and has spread to the uterus and/or the fallopian tubes and/or the ovaries. In stage IIB, cancer is found in one or both ovaries or fallopian tubes and has spread to the colon. In primary peritoneal cancer, cancer is found in the pelvic peritoneum and has not spread there from another part of the body.

MediaContent.Comment: 2016-01-26: Revised content & caption approved by OCC; added HP content & caption.
